title: Pregnant Amy Willerton shows baby bump on Seychelles holiday
text:
She recently announced she's expecting her first child with fiancé Daniel Day.

And Amy Willerton showed off her pregnancy glow - and blossoming baby bump - as she took to Instagram from her babymoon in the Seychelles on Wednesday.

The former I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! star, 26, looked fantastic as she lounged in a yellow bikini and patterned red trousers.

Glowing: Pregnant Amy Willerton, 26, showed off her growing baby bump in a series of Instagram Stories while on her babymoon in the Seychelles on Wednesday

Amy was relaxed and smiled as she told her 352K followers that her baby bump can 'really pop' after she's eaten.

She went makeup-free for the series of short clips and left her caramel-blonde hair down, wearing only a simple pair of earrings to accessorise her look

Amy said: 'It really does depend what I've eaten, what position the baby's in, but right now it looks massive.

Parents to be: I'm A Celebrity ... Get Me Out Of Here! star Amy and her fiancé Daniel Day, pictured in LA in 2016, announced they were expecting their first child on Sunday

'Last night I got offered cocktails and gin and beer - I don't think they could tell but right now you can definitely tell.'

During the trip, Amy has shared a series of luxurious insights into hers and Daniel's holiday.

The couple announced they are set to welcome their first child in an exclusive interview with HELLO! Magazine on Sunday.

Loving life: Amy looked fantastic as she lounged on holiday and told her followers that the size of her bump depends on what she's eaten and what position the baby is in

Stunning: Amy shared glimpses of her dinner with Daniel where she wore a glam halterneck dress which tied above her stomach, showing off her blossoming baby bump

Amy described the news as 'definitely the most wonderful engagement present we could ever wish for'.

The couple chose to wait two months longer than the recommended 12 weeks before revealing the pregnancy after they sought an amniocentesis to check for any disorders.

An amniocentesis can detect the chromosomal abnormalities that cause Downs, Edwards or Patau syndromes by taking a sample of the amniotic fluid that surrounds the baby by inserting a hollow needle into the uterus.

Golden: The reality TV star was full of smiles as she posed for snaps with her dapper looking fiancé after opting to wear a beautiful gold dress for dinner

Amy's family have a history of disability and her autistic brother Ross, 25, was born with an extra chromosome.

'Our unborn baby was, in fact, okay,' Amy said. And despite initially planning to marry next summer, Amy revealed the couple may push back the wedding.

Amy and Daniel became engaged after he proposed during skiing trip in March, surprising the reality star.

'I was all set to do some extreme skiing,' Amy said at the time. 'Then I spied a breakfast picnic set up with candles, a firepit, a bottle of our favourite champagne and red roses everywhere.'

Breaking tradition! Amy asked the sunglasses entrepreneur to propose for a second time because he made his original proposal on two bended knees

'Then he dropped to both knees and pulled out a box from his pocket containing the most beautiful ring. It felt like a dream.'

Afterwards she asked her beau to propose a second time to make sure everything was perfect. 'And the second time around I made him do it on one knee because I didn't know if proposing on both knees counted!'

At the early stages of their romance, Amy praised Daniel for giving her confidence during a candid interview back in August 2016.

The reality star, who was forced to deny that she was engaged just months after going public with her relationship, gushed to MailOnline: 'It's going really well and I'm very happy.'

Sweet: The winner of Miss Universe Great Britain admitted she expected a day of skiing on the slopes, but was surprised when the day included a proposal

Amy previously dated former TOWIE star Joey Essex after they struck up a friendship while appearing on I'm A Celeb in 2013.

At 17, Amy held the Miss Bristol title and later rose to fame after she won Katie Price's competition series Signed by Katie Price in 2011.

The bombshell went on to win Miss Bath in 2011, Miss London in 2012 and then reached the top 5 in the Miss England contest.

Amy has since forged a successful career in reality TV, starring in series such as I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! and The Jump.
description: Amy Willerton, 26, showed off her pregnancy glow and blossoming bump while on a babymoon in the Seychelles with her fiancé Daniel Day on Wednesday.
